author: A_Brickset_user
title: Not bad, but not the best.
review:
Pros:
Actually some darn good pieces in the arms. The joints should be good for mechs or mecha, and the detail pieces should be good for any number of things.
The sword is a very cool shape, and would be good for a Bionicle MOC, or again, mecha.
The assembled figure is pretty darn posable. More posable in some respects than a lot of Bionicle. (Lets see the Toa Metru spread their arms that wide.)
Mine came with an extra trans radar dish, which is always welcome.

Cons:
That shield. It's not even a particularly sturdy cardboard. I ended up taking it off entirely, and moving the sword to his right hand.
The torso, despite having a good number of connection points, is useless as anything but a torso.
The visor won't connect to anything but the head, which stinks.

author: Novelty
title: Galidor - Red
review:
There must have been quite a bit of leftover Galidor parts for the birth of the 6 Knights' Kingdom action figures.  Santis is the red one.  His action figure includes a rather intresting match of red bricks with grey highlights that makes it look like a walking fire truck.  The beige bits that are thrown in also makes the figure seems rather weird.

As a static action figure, this set has quite a bit of posability - there are joints all over the place.  However, it is not bottom heavy and will tend to fall rather easily.  There aren't any action features, no firing cannon, no glow in the dark stuff, nothing.

As a construction toy, this is bland.  None of the parts can be reused to build anything other than the main model.

Overall, these Knight Kingdom figures are a failure both as a construction toy and as an action figure.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Castle (Knights' Kingdom II) - Santis Review
review:
This is a very cool figure to have and it's fun to play with as well. The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to worry about stickers. The arms, the legs, the feet, the head and the visor can sviwel and on the back of the torso is a lever which you can use to move the arm which has a sword in the hand up and/or down. The other hand has a shield but it falls off very easily if you touch it. But this figure is still very easy to maneuver. As I told you in the beginning: It's a nice figure to have for sure - even for pieces which you can use for future MOC's (My own creations) and/or brickfilms.

All in all this set is an great set and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de
